title.narrative: 1.3 IMNCI AND EPI SERVICES

description.narrative: MoPH and health system have enhanced capacity to provide equitable access to quality immunization and IMNCI services, particularly in those regions affected by the protracted humanitarian crisis., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Emergencies, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: MoPH and health system have enhanced capacity to provide equitable access to quality immunization and IMNCI services, particularlyin those regions affected by the protracted humanitarian crisis.

description.narrative: COVID-19 prevention measures;have significantly hampered the importation of critical supplies with a subseqyent impact on service delivery for immunization and IMNCI. As of September 2021, there were reported stock-outs of all vaccine antigens except for Hepatitis B vaccines. Similarly, essential medicines, ORS and zinc were all stocked out at national level. National immunization coverage;declined, with only 54.8 per cent;of targeted children reached with DPT3 whilst the proportion of children with diarrhoea that were treated with ORS also dropped from 83 per cent;;to 19 per cent during the year. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:12/01/2022
